alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 6:43AM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Seboeis River flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Central Maine, including the following county, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas as the Seboeis River flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 AM EST, The Seboeis River is at 11.56 feet and rising. Minor flood stage is 11.0 feet. The river is expected to continue to climb through minor flood stage this morning. At 11.0 feet minor flooding of the Seboeis River trailhead parking area and trails is expected. Additional, minor low- lying flooding is likely with area creeks and streams that empty into the Seboeis River. At 14.0 feet, significant flooding of the Seboeis River trailhead parking area. ATV trail crossings upstream & downstream flooded. - Seboeis River near Shin Pond is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
